author: MaseL4
content: For a 3-star this place was more unformal and relaxed. The menu very well balanced as you might expect. So glad this restaurant survived trough the pandemia and that we could finally make our visit after two years planning. An experience to remember for years...to come.

author: U1973DYsimonm
content: Truly super experience from initial greeting to calling our taxi . Attentive and knowledgeable service - special mention to fabulous sommelier Shua and waitress Amaya . Lovely to speak to chef Elena and the food and wine really exceptional .Quality ingredients treated with respect and...complemented with great wine list which does not exploit . Really loved our experience and hope to return . Thank you Team Arzak

author: 17lennartd
content: An explosion of the senses with an exceptional hospitality like among friends. The very charming chef Elena, who has taken over the restaurant after 25 years of accompanying her father, creates with her warm manner and an excellent team a warm and friendly atmosphere that...is unparalleled. The interplay of exquisitely and artistically impressively presented delicacies gave us great pleasure. We will be thinking about these creations for years to come and can be more than grateful for this unique gourmet experience.

author: mkava8709
content: Whenever we are in San Sebastian (Donostia), Spain, we dine at Arzak.  This restaurant is truly a restaurant not to miss when in San Sebastian.  We have dined here many times over the years.  The multi-course meal is artwork.  Every dish was savory and perfect...in every way.  Elena Arzak has not only taken the helm from her father, but has elevated the dining experience to another level.

author: Scrumpping
content_title: Excellent but not the best 3 star Michelin I went to in 2021
content: You can’t really fault a 3 Star Michelin restaurant, the food was outstanding, creative and entertaining, the service was impeccable and the chat with the chef educational. However, you can rate one 3 star Michelin against another and for me eating at Quique Dacosta the...same year was a clear winner. So, only 4 for Arzak to reflect that.

author: wbarnim
content_title: Intellectual cuisine by the most charming chef I have ever encountered
content: This way my introduction to high-end Basque cuisine, so every dish Elena Arzak created for us was a surprise to me. I found the dinner incredibly educational and intellectually stimulating. Living in Thailand I very much appreciated her tributes to Asian cuisine too. We were...blown away by the details and the subtleness of her creations and she finally won my heart with the venison and ginger - daring but oh so good. Overall Arzak challenges it’s guests with exciting and at least for me often surprising flavors that coexist in a balanced tension in each of the fascinating dishes. The culinary journey was enhanced by the knowledgeable and attentive staff and Elena Azark’s own charming presence. She entertained us with stories of her honeymoon in Thailand and her - surprise - fluent German. We did not only dine in grand style but we were also made to feel so very warmly and personally welcome. Thank you so much for everything.

author: TomLuke123
content:
Arzak remains one of my favourites. It is a curious contradiction; an outstanding  and artistic yes simple and casual simultaneously.
Chef Elena Arzak knows her territory. The menu and the dishes are well balanced and executed, wine pairings superb ( excellent choices by the sommelier)....Loved the simplicity and taste of the egg and the pigeon. This restaurant lives up to its hype. 
I had memorable evening

author: Likop8
content_title: Sampling Michelin Restaurants in Bilbao and San Sabastian
content:
We as a travel group always try to sample Michelin restaurants wherever we go. During three days in Bilbao and San Sebastian, we had lunch at three different 3-star restaurants.  

We rank Arzak last and would not recommend it, especially if you get to only...visit a single Michelin restaurant in the area. For example, we had a table for six in an alcove at the end of a long narrow dining room. We did have a bit more privacy but we had servers bumping up against us for three hours because of a lack of space. We would have been better off had we exchanged locations with a table for two close to us. Because we are not visible from the main dining room we tend not to get replenished with different items. Ladies have to put their purses on the floor, not such a big deal, but not what we usually see in a 3-star Michelin. It startled us a bit when the staff pulled out a ballpoint pen to point at all the different dessert items on this dessert tree of goodies. The food is decent, but the service and the setting fell short. Compare to the other two 3-star restaurants, the price is similar, but the value is less.

author: actlad
content:
We dined at Arzak while
Vacationing with another 
couple visiting San Sebastián for the first time. Amazing experience from the moment we arrived. The warmth of the staff, 
Ambiance, amazing food, creative  presentation and the knowledgeable sommelier who introduced us to Spanish wines rivaling the...best in the world. Mariano was exceptional. Fabulous experience.

author: Janette2730
content: Lovely homely welcome at this prestigious address. Very comfortable surroundings in the upstairs section of this restaurant. Food and service was exceptional and our maître d was both charming and helpful. We both enjoyed the tasting menu and in part is was tailored so suit...our tastes as my my wife does not have a sweet tooth. We were happy to engage with Elena and also pleased to receive a copy of the menu on exiting the restaurant.  The wine list was extensive and unfortunately we did not have sufficient time to take it all in, suffice to say it did contain good wine at reasonable prices. Would definitely return.

content:
This is quite simply the best meal I have had in my entire life. We went there for my 50th Birthday meal and the food was divine, the staff welcoming and made you feel very relaxed. 

It was expensive but not as expensive as I’d...

author: Kenneth J
content:
A large variety of excellent food, pleasant surroundings, great experience!
One of the best meals we have ever had.

author: Sanjay0123456

author: 583cassiaf
content_title: Fine dining, and meet Elena Arzak

author: David G
content_title: One of a kind Special Places and Memory
content:
Arzak is simply a MUST visit location in the Basque Region if you are able to make it and it you are not you are simply missing one of those memorable experiences

Do not be put off by the understated locations, just outside San Sebastián...

author: Luxetravel23

author: 1Heiko101

content:
When we shell out €230 euros per head and that does not include the drinks, we expect nothing but food that will blow our minds. Sadly Arzak failed to deliver.

We must admit that the service is impeccable. There is nothing to fault. Very attentive...

author: 60sparky08

author: cherylg430
content:

author: David J

author: Derek M

author: manor778

As Chef Elena has deceived it — “singular, Basque, evolving, research-based and avant-garde" 
Service is impeccable. Ambiance is very comfortable. Wine list is quite extensive. 
Perfect Meal!

Located about a 10-minute car ride away from the city center, the building that hosts it...

Each dish is a master piece combination of flavours and textures.

We have some dining experience in several 3 stars Michelin restaurants, Arzak are on the top of...

Was especially nice that a restauarant of this standard had an extensive reasonable priced wine list, made the food being so much more expensive a...

author: Frederick201

Incredible experience, food and service in every single way! Never to be forgotten! Iconic! 

Every dish was so memorable. We were offered a menu each and enjoyed different  courses throughout to get a full sample of Arzak cuisine! Incredible.

author: Motherhen408
content_title: Amazing Experience not to be missed in San Sebastian

author: india_evanss

author: anne_travel1

author: 590louisac

We had a smaller version of the tasting menu which I would highly recommend. The best dessert of chocolate in a fruit sauce that I have...

author: ryanuuy

author: priorityfood

content:
The past reviews really say it all.  GO!

friendly and attentive staff, food excellent and chefs welcoming

the food and the art of presentation is string on its own and gadgets detract

author: Peter James R

author: ben_c20

Arzak is a wonderful family run establishment located 14 mins east of downtown San Sebastian on a nondescript street. There is parking located behind the restaurant if you are traveling by car. But they do valet park. 

Even before our starters arrived, Arzak goes above...

For such a fantastic restaurant, we were pleased to find that it had none of that stuffiness or...

author: FRDR
content_title: Not what I was expecting from a top rated restaurant
content:
It is very hard to make a review about this place. First because I was really expecting greatness and not reaching it might hurt a little the review, but I always try to be fair. 
To make it easier, I will comment on service, food,...

author: beautifulediblelife
content_title: Worst, most expensive meal, in all of Spain
content: We spent three weeks in Spain, traveling from Madrid to Seville to Barcelona and finally San Sebastian.  We had amazing meals in every city - DiverXo, el Club Allard, La Azotea, 41 Degrees - and were anticipating our meal at Arzak because it had the...

author: Hang Chung N
content: This is a MUST if you like fine dinning, taste, service, presentation, ect.Order the tasting menu it`s worth every penny

author: GillyG18
content_title: Simply superb. An experience of a lifetime; staff could relax a little!
content:
Hubby and I had a FABULOUS visit to Arzak during a driving holiday in the Basque country.  The eight course tasting menu was incredible.  The front of house staff could relax a little, the enamel won't crack!!

We would love to visit again - still...

author: RuwanSilva
content: San Sebastián is a awesome place if you like food. The pintxos bars keep dishing out the most amazing food all through the day and so many michelin starred restaurants to choose from as well. We chose Arzak because we had heard so much about...

author: jcclemos
content_title: Even Better than Adria or any other restaurant!!
content:
I heart a lot of about Arzak's Restaurant, but I had never been there before.
I was curious to know how the Arzak family could have the title of one of the best of the worlds from more than a hundred years, and when I...

author: textibule
content: This is one of the best food/restaurant experiences I've ever had. It happens to be in one of the food capitols of the world (IMHO). Service relaxed but helpful and attentive. Each dish on the tasting menu (that's sort of how it rolls in a...

author: Steve K
content: Arzak is a restaurant that easily merits 3 stars from Michelin. The food is amazingly creative and delicious. We've dined here three times and each time we are pleasantly surprised by the dishes on the tasting menu. The wine list is incredible, with very attractive...

author: Washington20
content:
Arzak is a special restaurant, and most deserving of its 3 michelin stars.

The service is a true stand-out, reflecting a casual, understated elegance and sophistication rarely found at any restaurant.  More on this in a moment.

The home of molecular gastronomy, Arzak doesn't need...

author: J F
content: This is a world famous restaurant that deserves the accolades it receives.  The staff is welcoming and courteous - willing and available to provide information and offer advice, as required.  The sommelier is not only extremely knowledgeable but also has the integrity to recommend wines...

author: Jenny L
content:
This is my first visit to a Michelin restaurant, and I was not disappointed. 

We were given excellent advice from the sommelier (who was not pushing the most expensive bottle), and the floor manager was very pleasant and helpful.

We went for the Tasting menu;...

author: Jason P
content_title: Poor service, clumsy bland dishes, not what it used to be
content: The planned pinnacle of my trip to Europe was to dine at Restaurant Arzak on my 40th birthday and enjoy a spectacular meal as I the one I enjoyed 6 years earlier that I heralded as the best meal ever until I dined at Martín...

author: 832LarsB
content_title: A good evening but slightly disappointing for a *** restaurant
content: Was surprised to see that I manage to book a table only one month in advance. The restaurant is situated a good 20 min walk from the city center in a not very interesting neighborhood. Welcome was nice in the beautiful restaurant. We had a...

author: toniet1974
content: We had a really good meal at Arzak. We found the food was very interesting using many local ingredients. The food was all spectacular and the service also very attentive. We sat in the upstairs part of the restaurant which had a great atmosphere and...

author: Winehen
content: We visited San Sebastian primarily to eat and we ate VERY well. Arzak was on our list to try since we had seen the restaurant featured on travel and cooking shows in the U.S. Our lunch did not disappoint and was worth every euro. The...

author: laughingcake
content: very welcoming restaurant, the food was amazing and we were lucky enough to meet Elena and Juan Mari Arzac who gave our visit the personal touch and Elena explained to our children how the different meals were prepared.  We would definitely return if we get...

author: hpctravellor
content: My wife was more excited than I about Arzak, she knew the chefs' reputations having seen enough on tv. But the food really was awesome - each course was special, well thought through in terms of flavours & presentation. The service was excellent & the...

author: AdelaideAnna
content: We had a superb lunch.  Our expectations were high and we were still left surprised and delighted by the dishes - even after many years of eating at restaurants that have copied the style, this was still a cut well above - original, masterful and...

author: SamJoL
content: I visited this place with three friends, we all had high expectations and I must say it delivered. The food was incredible and nothing was too much trouble for the staff, I requested additional dishes to the normal tasting menu and they sent them out...

author: tdcCT
content_title: Arzak delivers a once in a lifetime experience
content: We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner at Arzak.  The food is delicious, innovative, attractively presented but sometimes slightly over the top.  Molecular gastronomy delivers in many ways but is pushed a bit too far in others.  The space is pretty, the service professional and the visit...

author: DonKnox25
content: Let me begin by saying that lunch at Arzak was an incredible dining experience!  But, that being said, there was a missed opportunity when it came to a vegetarian menu.  We had advised upon reserving that we had a member of our party that was...

author: SafariSlim
content_title: One of the best meals we've ever had
content:
To say that we indulged a little by visiting this restaurant is an understatement.

It is located a short drive outside of the main town that is Donostia San-Sebastian.

We also went to Mugaritz on this stay, and I definitely have to say that the...

author: DavyQ
content:
When planning our trip to Spain, this was definitely on our to-do list. Have to book quite a few months in advance but totally worth it. The food was in a word awesome. 

One of our friends did get some wine spilled on her but...

author: PJC0598
content_title: More than a meal, a culinary show!
content:
We came to experience one of the top restaurants in the world and were not disappointed. The food was simply delicious with an amazing variety of flavors. Service was as you can expect from a very high end place.
This is not something one does...

author: Harry G
content: Hard to add on to this restaurant's already large installed fan base.  I will say that we did tour the wine cave and found that they had a really large and varied selection.  Many wines date to the 50's thanks in large part to this...

author: jobetim
content_title: Not in The World's Top 10 Restaurants for nothing!
content: Stellar experience at hyper-stellar prices, this is an extraordinary restaurant.  Taking the culinary art to new heights, this food is just about as far removed from any normal eatery as it's possible to get. As the only 3* Michelin place we've eaten in, it's not...

author: oooh-aah
content: I recommend dining at Arzak, but I probably wouldn't do it again. It's very expensive. You can eat better in San Sebastian and for way less money. Try it once though you really should. I recommend Agorregi as an alternative. The food is better and...

author: lecastaneda
content: Food is definitely not conventional but the combinations are excellent. We opted not to have the degustation menu as we prefer to taste more than just samples. However, we were very delicately pushed in that direction anyway. When we ordered one appetizer, one main course...

author: Baba-Kahawa
content: We had a table of 8. We were able to taste all that the family had to offer.  This is basque style food pushed to the limits.  There was a hint of the old world flavor with the modern twist that the Spanish have made...

author: Stephan L
content: The food is obviously fantastic, expensive as I would expect, but the experience is overwhelming. I would recommend if you are looking want something different. Creativity presented in an unforgettable all-senses experience. Lucky to have met her to chat even briefly. Very unique !

author: poropat
content_title: No wow factor, and poor value for money.
content:
We were full of expectation about Arzak. Sadly, the expectation was not fulfilled. 

Firstly, to correct some of the other reviewers, the degustation menu is not 189 euro, but 207.9 euro - there's a small matter of 10 per cent IVA to be added which...

author: multitrippers
content: We booked 3 restaurants with three Michelin stars whilst we were in San Sebastián.    Two of the restaurants took our booking and it was completely straightforward but what a hassle to get a table at Arzak and the amount of emails we had to send....

author: zullli
content: Ranked amongst the top ten best restaurant in the world the degustation menu was a great way to taste trademark dishes and get an understanding for the cuisine. The price of  EUR189 is of course on the high side, however the ARIA in Sydney is...

author: Excursion471
content: We had the tasting menu in the evening. The food was truly amazing, each course expertly presented and the waiting staff explained each one as the food was brought it to us. The amuse bouche were magical and a sign of things to come. The...

author: GuilhermeR902
content: Arzak is nestled in a quaint and charming house. We were seated in the ground floor dinning room, the room is handsome with an unfussied modern decor. I can safely say that the room is a little underwhelming, but we are here for the food....

content_title: Truly an experience - A must in San Sebastian!
content: Booked for lunch for 4 and we had the tasting menu. It was such a nice experience ( I say experience because it's more than gastronomical, it was the service, the presentation and the overall atmosphere) that we did not realised we were there for...

author: Robert S
content: Amazing place! Get the big tasting menu. There are some choices that you can still make. The Kobe burger comes with an excellent surprise.

author: KJB02
content:
We booked for lunch at Arzak some months ago to make sure that we could experience Arzak's legendary food while we were in San Sebastián.  We were met at the taxi by the restaurant staff and from then on the service was flawless.

We both...

author: SBF2
content: From the moment you enter to the moment you leave you will be amazed at the sights, smells, tastes and service.  Creative dishes served in creative ways by some extremely talented people.  Well worth the trip.

author: Biorno
content: I must admit: celebrating my 60 years anniversary was never in my mind. I didn't like to think of my age at this time. My wife took me to Donostia, San Sebastian, and she really made my day. She had booked a table at Arzak...

author: DougWalker
content: Booked Arzak shortly after booking accommodation in San Sebastián, after hearing many good things. The first evening sitting was at 8.45pm, as you might expect in Spain, and Arzak is a 5-10 minute taxi ride from the city centre, so we milled about outside briefly...

author: Mark E
content_title: A feast for all the senses
content:
Everything here feels like an almost sinfully pleasurable indulgence.  The decor is tasteful, surprising, dark and sexy. The main event - the food - continues the seduction. We had the tasting (degustacion) menu and when the dishes started coming they were simply astonishing.  

As much...

author: OhBabyItsBen

author: j0hnkl
content: I was here actually way back in 2003 and it was the most memorable dining experience ever. The evening actually started slow. We had a reservation so we were seated immediately as soon as we arrive. However, we have to wait about 30 min before...

author: FlyingWineman

I've decided therefore in this review to limit criticism of what we considered to be a disappointing experience, to factual...

author: Reductio
content:
Arzak is truly a 3 star Michelin restaurant, in its presentation, taste and service. The wine cellar is impressive, and so is the food. 

First of all, we had a dedicated waiter speaking perfect English presenting every dish in almost a poetic way. 

Second of...

author: FlyingWineman
content: When you've heard so much about a restaurant's reputation, there can be a danger that one’s pre-conceived expectations are so high, that disappointment is inevitable. author: garygmem

author: edward s
content_title: Wonderful food and culinary theater at Arzak
content:
We just concluded a family holiday in San Sebastian and had the good fortune to get a reservation at 3 Michelin-starred Arzak. My wife and I brought our two boys along ,ages 14 and 11, and the experience was superlative.

author: Lorne_Alexandra

author: richardw210
content: We have dined here many times and have, almost without exception, been thrilled with our experience. The food is always excellent and most of the servers and certainly the chef-owners are wonderful, welcoming and attentive. The sommelier is excellent as well. The head waiter is...

author: lchaimliat

author: Josh S
content_title: A fantastic dinner worth the money
content: We loved this restaurant! We ordered the tasting menu. We each made a couple different choices so we could share more of the dishes. The food was extraordinary. The wait staff was fantastic. We felt comfortable. And the air conditioning was at an appropriate temperature...

author: LesH211
content_title: Is this the best restaurant in the world ?
content:
I need another category that comes after "excellent" and 5 stars for Arzak, which is a 3* Michelin that goes out of it's way to ensure that the whole experience of being there is more than just about the spectacular food. 
There are no words...

author: ckolton
content_title: 3 Michelin Star Restaurant That Actually Cares If You Enjoy It
content: I've had the good fortune now to have eaten at several 2- and 3-Michelin star restaurants and without fail the prevailing attitude almost always just assumes you're enjoying it -- because how could someone not enjoy the work of Chef X?  Arzak is the "almost"...

author: Karensheree
content: What a wonderful lunch experience. 3michelin stars and thoroughly deserved. What I liked most was that the service was not stuffy or aloof, and the food was out of this world. Loved it!

author: danshe
content: This was an outstanding experience. The textures, flavors and the presentations were just spectacular. But besides the food one of the great things about Arzak is that it’s a down to earth place, with wine menu that doesn’t require a trust fund and staff that...

author: Paul M
content:
Great meal and old service the sommelier was only ok but the food was so good it didn't matter 

Lobster, lamb and giant truffle my favorites 

Don't go past the tasting menu is well balanced and excellent

author: Tbone555
content: If you are penny wise and dollar foolish, dont go to Arzark. It is not for you.  They will even reccomend a dozen or so pintxo bars you will enjoy.  However, if you appreciate the sublime please go.  Even your wildest expectations will be blown...

author: jlb3
content_title: Hate to say it, but overrated
content:
Arzak is a classic. Arzak has three Michelin stars. At a bill topping USD$700 for two it was the most expensive restaurant we dined in throughout the country, even among several of its three-star competitors that we also visited.

Of all of the fine dining...

author: rumtytum
content_title: Is haute cuisine losing its way?

author: Patricia B

author: K5071EAandreat

author: EuroTravellerMelb

content:
After having dined at many Michellin starred restaurants and at Arzak 3 years previously, it appears to me that Arzak is losing its way.

Perhaps we caught the restaurant on a bad (Friday) night, but the food was overly fussy with taste coming in a...

author: Cuquios316
content_title: One of the finest in the world!
content: It is quite an experience. Arzak and his daughter, Elena, are charming. They are very down to earth, despite their talent and fame.  The cuisine is innovative and exquisite.

author: cooltide

author: nocheckedbags21
content: Treat yourself to a gastronomic journey of taste, texture, aroma, visual art, and refined service.  One must be willing to embrace the experience, be willing to accept the mastery of the kitchen and recognize the brilliance of creativity arising from the most fundamental ingredients.  This...

author: Bourgogneboy
content:

Our dinner here was the second of 4 meals...

author: AKAFCO

content_title: Communing with the Basque culinary gods
content: This is special occasion dining: innovative, delicious, expensive. We came for lunch, ate the tasting menu and cannot speak more highly of the total experience. The food is complex and thoughtful without being pretentious, gimmicky or unapproachable. The service was faultless and very personalised. We...

author: SCC1983

content: I only had an hour's notice before going to Arzak.  I asked the concierge at Villa Soro for restaurant recommendations, and she suggested Arzak, a 3-star Michelin restaurant nearby.  "But they're not going to have any availability are they?" I asked.  "Well, we can try,"...

author: Raul-UVA

author: tikiNicosia

Special place, cozy atmosphere.
Had pidgin as a main course, and it was soft and tasty.
Everything ran smoothly and every dish was a surprise - Parmesan lolly, "lunatico" candy and...

author: SusanaB853
content: Food & presentation according to our expecatations. Food is very interesting, flavours are very original and beautifully served. Be prepared for the unexpected. The staff is very helpfull and nice. We felt spoiled by the nice lady with blonde short hair and the very helpfull...

author: DaveEgglestone
content: Food was interesting but thought the service whilst fine was a little lacking in engaging the customer. Dress rules were very varied for a 3 Michelin star restaurant

author: D P

author: Sandra K
content_title: TOP TOP TOP..... the best We've had in years
content:
Creative, innovative, a burst of flavours, colors and aromas... Loved it
Ahora en espaniol. Excelente almuerzo, creativo, el chef Jose Mari Arzak simpatiquisimo y atento al mas minimo detalle. 100% vale la pena

author: siseale
content: Experience genius in Dining. The expense is well worth the experience! Wonderful wine selection. Make reservations!

author: coolriggs

content: There are world rankings for a reason and why Arzak remains in the top 10.  We had the 12 course tasting menu and were beyond pleasantly surprised with the food, ambiance, consistency, and particularly creativity into each dish.  Additionally, as you look across 3-stars and...

content: We had a fantastic lunch time at Arzak. If you like trying different things, enjoy food and also have a 'give it a go' attitude you should enjoy yourself. The presentation was artistic but also had a degree of fun attached to it. There is...

author: Kiwi-child

author: Los Y
content:
Outstanding in every way. We also dined in higher rated restaurants and felt this one should be in the top 3. 
The food, service, ambience, and decor rival any restaurant in the world. The sommelier is stupendous.
We will definitely go back.

author: Foncol

content: This place is a must for anybody who is serious about tasting fantastic food at its best form.  Very expensive but worth to try once!!!

author: Ono O
content: This restaurant was on my list of Must Dos, and I was pleased by the experience... not blown away, but very happy to have enjoyed the culinary experience. I had the tasting menu and was surprised that within the menu, there was choices to be...

author: Shari C

author: sftravelholic
content_title: More than dinner, it's an experience!
content: From the moment we stepped out of the taxi, the staff was friendly, helpful, charming and totally unpretentious ...welcoming us into a sleek, modern but also warm ambiance.  Needless to say (but, I will anyway), our dinner was delightful and delicious. Though they are known...

author: Brad S
content:
Let me start with the only downside...it is a bit on the noisy side.  The flip side of this statement is of course that it is lively and bustling.

We had the tasting menu....this is what to get.  Yes it is more expensive, but you...

author: duluth54321
content:

I...

author: smarshy5

author: Travlingfoodie
content: In a Relais and Chateau property the most iconic restaurant of San Sebastian. The food is always delicious and memorable. Excellent wine selection. The father daughter duo in the kitchen present a fabulous menu. I have loved everything there especially the seafood. Very artistic preparations.

content:
Everything you expect in a 3 star restaraunt - incredible tastes and visual adventures. Tried the tasting - so need to be there by 10pm.  One fish course comes with a green dome, made out of rice and sea grass - all elible.

content:

We went for lunch. Our arrival we were very quickly ushered to our table in the restaurant. We did not have a brilliant  table which was right next to the staircase so this...

author: Pennydoctor

content:
Exemplary!

Arzak is regularly in the list of Top 10 restaurants in the world. But, if you want to go, book up well in advance! We booked up six months in advance.  It was worth the wait.

We came to San Sebastian for a  weekend...

author: KevinBrasil

Brilliance, that is what we received. 
It is so difficult to describe accurately just how good it was. Imagine...

author: deepsapphyr

author: passeron99
content: Chef-owner Juan Mari Arzak has mastered the mix of robust Mediterranean flavors with homey Americana. . Appetizers may include butternut squash risotto topped with white truffles, while pan-seared black cod with white bean-eggplant puree and prime rib with tapenade are likely to appear as entrées.
